name: In the Matter of the Appeal of Raymond L. ATTLEBERGER from the Action of the Secretary of Transportation of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in Suspending His Motor Vehicle Operator's License. Appeal of Raymond L. ATTLEBERGER
name_abbreviation: In re the Appeal of Attleberger

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
LARSEN, J., dissents and would address the merits of the case.
parties: In the Matter of the Appeal of Raymond L. ATTLEBERGER from the Action of the Secretary of Transportation of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in Suspending His Motor Vehicle Operator’s License. Appeal of Raymond L. ATTLEBERGER.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN, J., dissents and would address the merits of the case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Joseph J. Liotta, III, Brandt, Liotta & Stuttler, Franklin, for appellant.
Harold H. Cramer, Asst. Chief Counsel, Timothy P. Wile, Asst. Counsel in Charge, Dept, of Transp., Harrisburg, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
613 A.2d 1203
In the Matter of the Appeal of Raymond L. ATTLEBERGER from the Action of the Secretary of Transportation of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in Suspending His Motor Vehicle Operator’s License. Appeal of Raymond L. ATTLEBERGER.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 21, 1992.
Decided Oct. 14, 1992.
Joseph J. Liotta, III, Brandt, Liotta & Stuttler, Franklin, for appellant.
Harold H. Cramer, Asst. Chief Counsel, Timothy P. Wile, Asst. Counsel in Charge, Dept, of Transp., Harrisburg, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
